sen.j: 加茂駅（かもえき）は、京都府木津川市加茂町駅西1丁目6-3にある、西日本旅客鉄道（JR西日本）関西本線の鉄道駅。
sen.e: Kamo Station (located in Eki-Nishi, Kamo-cho, Kizugawa City, Kyoto Prefecture) is the station of the Kansai Main Line that is operated by West Japan Railway Company (JR West).
Kamo Station, located in Eki-Nishi, Kamo-cho, Kizugawa City, Kyoto Prefecture, is the station of the Kansai Main Line that is operated by the West Japan Railway Company (JR West).
Kamo Station, located in 1-6-3, Eki-Nishi, Kamo-cho, Kizugawa City, Kyoto Prefecture, is the station of the Kansai Main Line that is operated by the West Japan Railway Company (JR West).

sen.j: 電化・非電化の境界駅であり、旅客案内上では当駅より木津方の電化区間は「大和路線」と呼称される。
sen.e: This station separates the electrified section and non-electrified section of the line and when guiding passengers, the electrified section situated in Kizu Station side of this station is called "Yamatoji Line".

This station separates the electrified section from the non-electrified section of the line, and when guiding passengers the electrified section situated in the Kizu Station side of this station is called the "Yamatoji Line."

This station separates the electrified section from the non-electrified section of the line, and when guiding passengers the electrified section situated in the Kizu Station side of this station is called the 'Yamatoji Line.'

sen.j: 加茂駅は1897年（明治30年）に奈良経由で大阪と名古屋を結ぶ関西鉄道の駅として開業した。
sen.e: Kamo Station came into operation in 1897 as the station of Kansei Railway Company that operated the line connecting Osaka and Nagoya via Nara.
Kamo Station came into operation in 1897 as a station of Kansei Railway Company, which operated the line connecting Osaka and Nagoya via Nara.
Kamo Station came into operation in 1897 as a station of Kansei Railway Company, which operated the line connecting Osaka and Nagoya via Nara.

sen.j: 私鉄であった関西鉄道は、官設の東海道本線と競争関係にあったが、1907年（明治40年）に国有化され関西本線となった。
sen.e: The line operated by Kansei Railway Company, which was a private railway, had been in competition with the state-operated Tokaido Main Line but in 1907, the company was nationalized and its line became the Kansai Main Line.

The line operated by Kansei Railway Company, which was a private railway, had been in competition with the state-operated Tokaido Main Line, but in 1907 the company was nationalized and its line became the Kansai Main Line.

The line operated by Kansei Railway Company, which was a private railway, had been in competition with the state-operated Tokaido Main Line, but in 1907 the company was nationalized and its line became the Kansai Main Line.

sen.j: その後、日本国有鉄道（国鉄）を経て、1987年（昭和62年）JR西日本の駅となる。
sen.e: Later, the line once became the line of Japan National Railways (JNR) and eventually has become the line operated by West Japan Railway Company (JR West) in 1987.
Later, the line became the line of Japan National Railways (JNR) and eventually it became the line operated by the West Japan Railway Company (JR West) in 1987.
Later, the line became the line of Japan National Railways (JNR) and eventually it became the line operated by the West Japan Railway Company (JR West) in 1987.

sen.j: 国鉄時代まで加茂駅付近は非電化のままであったが、JR西日本となった翌年の1988年3月、木津駅から加茂駅までの電化が完成し、同時に湊町駅（のちのJR難波駅）から加茂駅までを大和路線の愛称で呼称することとなった。
sen.e: Although the line nearby Kamo Station had not been electrified during the era of JNR, the electrification of the section between Kizu Station and Kamo Station was completed in March 1988, the following year of the inauguration of JR West, and the section between Minatomachi Station (JR Nanba Station) and Kamo Station started to be called by the nickname of the Yamatoji Line.

Although the line near to Kamo Station had not been electrified during the era of JNR, the electrification of the section between Kizu Station and Kamo Station was completed in March 1988, the year following the inauguration of JR West, and the section between Minatomachi Station (JR Nanba Station) and Kamo Station started to be called by the nickname of the Yamatoji Line.

Although the line near to Kamo Station had not been electrified during the era of JNR, the electrification of the section between Kizu Station and Kamo Station was completed in March 1988, the year following the inauguration of JR West, and the section between Minatomachi Station (JR Nanba Station) and Kamo Station started to be called by the nickname of the Yamatoji Line.

sen.j: 大和路線はJR西日本の大阪近郊路線の総称であるアーバンネットワークの一路線として位置付けられるものであり、これ以来加茂駅は、都市近郊路線（大阪駅方面）と、非電化のローカル路線（亀山駅 (三重県)方面）の境界駅としての位置づけが与えられた。
sen.e: Since then, Kamo Station has become the station which separates the metropolitan suburban line (to Osaka Station) and the non-electrified local line (to Kameyama Station (Mie Prefecture)) because the Yamatoji Line is one of the lines that constitute the Urban Network, a collective term of suburban lines of Osaka area.

Subsequently, Kamo Station became the station separating the metropolitan suburban line (to Osaka Station) and the non-electrified local line (to Kameyama Station (Mie Prefecture)) because the Yamatoji Line is one of the lines that constitute the Urban Network, a collective term for suburban lines in the Osaka area.

Subsequently, Kamo Station became the station separating the metropolitan suburban line (to Osaka Station) and the non-electrified local line (to Kameyama Station (Mie Prefecture)) because the Yamatoji Line is one of the lines that constitute the Urban Network, a collective term for suburban lines of JR West in the Osaka area.
sen.cmt: JR West を追加しました。

sen.j: これ以降も正式な線路名称上では関西本線単独駅であることは変わらないものの、案内上では、当駅から奈良・天王寺方面を「大和路線」、亀山方面を「関西本線」と呼称を分けており、車内放送でも当駅が「大和路線」と「関西本線」の乗換駅として扱われている。
sen.e: Even after that, this station is still the station of the Kansai Main Line officially but in practice, Nara・Tennoji side and Kameyama side of this station are called distinctly as "Yamatoji Line" and "Kansai Main Line" respectively and this station is treated as the transfer station between"Yamatoji Line" and "Kansai Main Line" in guidance announced in trains.

Even after that, this has officially remained the station of the Kansai Main Line; however, in practice the Nara・Tennoji side and Kameyama side of this station are distinctly referred to as "Yamatoji Line" and "Kansai Main Line" respectively, and this station is treated as the transfer station between the "Yamatoji Line" and the "Kansai Main Line" in the guidance announced on trains.

Even after that, this has officially remained the station of the Kansai Main Line; however, in practice the Nara and Tennoji side and Kameyama side of this station are distinctly referred to as 'Yamatoji Line' and 'Kansai Main Line' respectively, and this station is treated as the transfer station between the 'Yamatoji Line' and the 'Kansai Main Line' in the guidance announced on trains.

sen.j: 本項においても、以下ではこの形式に従いそれぞれを別路線と扱い記述する。
sen.e: According to the above practice, 2 lines are to be treated as different lines in the description of this colum.
According to the above practice, two lines are to be treated as different lines in the description of this column.
According to the above practice, two lines are to be treated as different lines in the description of this article.

sen.j: 大阪方面からの電化区間（大和路線）やICOCA・Jスルーの利用可能エリア（ICOCAの相互利用対象であるSuica（東日本旅客鉄道）・PiTaPa（スルッとKANSAI協議会）も含む）は当駅までである。
sen.e: The electrified section as well as the section where ICOCA・J-through (including Suica (East Japan Railway Company (JR East)・PiTaPa (SURUTTO KANSAI ASSOCIATION) that are mutually usable with ICOCA) is available also extend from Osaka to this station.

The electrified section as well as the section where ICOCA・J-through (including Suica (East Japan Railway Company (JR East)・PiTaPa (SURUTTO KANSAI ASSOCIATION), which are mutually usable with ICOCA) is available, also extend from Osaka to this station.

The electrified section as well as the section where ICOCA and J-through cards (including Suica (East Japan Railway Company (JR East)) and PiTaPa (SURUTTO KANSAI ASSOCIATION), which are mutually usable with ICOCA) can be used, also extend from Osaka to this station.
sen.cmt: can be used としました。

sen.j: 2面3線の島式ホームを有する地上駅で、橋上駅を持つ。
sen.e: This station is a ground station that has 2 island-style platforms for 3 tracks and a station building on the bridge.
This station is a ground station that has two island-style platforms for three tracks and a station building on the bridge.
This station is a ground station that has two island-style platforms for three tracks and a station building on the bridge.

sen.j: 中央の線（2・3番のりば）は両側にホームがある。
sen.e: These platforms are located both sides of the center track (track 2 and 3).
These platforms are located at both sides of the center track (Platform 2 and 3).
These platforms are located at both sides of the center track (Platform 2 and 3).

sen.j: また、ここは関西本線の奈良方面と亀山方面との乗り継ぎ駅となっている。
sen.e: This station is the transfer station between Nara side and Kameyama side of the Kansai Main Line.
This station is the transfer station between the Nara side and the Kameyama side of the Kansai Main Line.
This station is the transfer station between the Nara side and the Kameyama side of the Kansai Main Line.

sen.j: ここから大阪方面には6両以上の電車が、亀山方面には1～2両程度の気動車が発着するという、かなり極端な駅である。
sen.e: This is a quite unique station because from this station, trains connectiong 6 electric cars depart for Osaka while trains connecting 1～2 diesel cars depart for Kameyama.
This is quite a unique station because, from this station, trains connecting six electric cars depart for Osaka while trains connecting one or two diesel cars depart for Kameyama.
This is quite a unique station because, from this station, trains connecting six electric cars depart for Osaka while trains connecting one or two diesel cars depart for Kameyama.

sen.j: 路線風景もここを境にがらっと変わる。
sen.e: The scenery along the line also changes drastically after passing this station.
The scenery along the line also changes drastically beyond this station.
The scenery along the line also changes drastically beyond this station.

sen.j: 普段は1・2番のりばのみで発着を賄っており、列車運用の都合に応じて3・4番のりばを使用している。
sen.e: Although track 1 and 2 are in use for the arrival and departure of trains under normal circumstances, track 3 and 4 are also used depending on the need of operation.
Although tracks 1 and 2 are in use for the arrival and departure of trains under normal circumstances, tracks 3 and 4 are also used depending on the requirements of operation.
Although Platform 1 and 2 are in use for the arrival and departure of trains under normal circumstances, Platform 3 and 4 are also used depending on the requirements of operation.

sen.j: 中央の線（2・3番のりば）に発着する列車のうち、亀山方面発着列車は2番のりば、大和路線列車は3番のりばで客扱いを行う。
sen.e: As for trains arriving at or depart from the center track (track 2 and 3), those running between this station and Kameyama onward use track 2 and those running on the Yamatoji Line use track 3.
As for trains arriving at or departing from the center track (tracks 2 and 3), those running between this station and Kameyama onward use track 2 while those running on the Yamatoji Line use track 3.

As for trains arriving at or departing from the center track (Platform 2 and 3), those running between this station and Kameyama onward use Platform 2 while those running on the Yamatoji Line use Platform 3.

sen.j: 但し例外もあり、中央の線の亀山方面発着列車に接続する大和路線列車が4番のりばに入線した場合、前者は両方の扉を開き、当駅での乗降客を2番のりば、乗換客を3番のりばで客扱いすることで、乗換の利便性を図っている（中央の線の大和路線列車に接続する亀山方面からの列車が1番のりばに入った場合も前者が両扉扱いを行い、この場合は2番のりばが乗換ホームとなる）。
sen.e: Exceptionally, when trains of the Yamatoji Line which are scheduled to make connections with trains departing for Kameyama from the center track arrive at track 4, trains bound for Kameyama open the doors of both sides so that passengers who get on and get off at this station can use track 2 and those who transfer at this station can use track 3 (when trains coming from Kameyama which are scheduled to make connections with trains of the Yamatoji Line leaving from the center track arrive at track 1, trains of the Yamatoji Line open the doors of both sides and in this case, track 2 is used for passengers to transfer).

Exceptionally, when trains of the Yamatoji Line that are scheduled to make connections with trains departing for Kameyama from the center track arrive at track 4, trains bound for Kameyama open the doors of both sides so that passengers who get on and get off at this station can use track 2 and those who transfer at this station can use track 3 (when trains coming from Kameyama, which are scheduled to make connections with trains of the Yamatoji Line leaving from the center track, arrive at track 1, trains of the Yamatoji Line open the doors of both sides and, in this case, track 2 is used for passengers to transfer).

Exceptionally, when trains of the Yamatoji Line that are scheduled to make connections with trains departing for Kameyama from the center track arrive at Platform 4, trains bound for Kameyama open the doors of both sides so that passengers who get on and get off at this station can use Platform 2 and those who transfer at this station can use Platform 3 (when trains coming from Kameyama, which are scheduled to make connections with trains of the Yamatoji Line leaving from the center track, arrive at Platform 1, trains of the Yamatoji Line open the doors of both sides and, in this case, Platform 2 is used for passengers to transfer).

sen.j: 加茂～木津間電化開業に伴う1988年3月13日のダイヤ改正で、当駅から大和路線・大阪環状線への直通列車が設定された。
sen.e: Thanks to the revision of schedule implemented as of March 13, 1988 in association with the completion of electrification between Kamo and Kizu, trains that depart from this station and directly run through into the Yamatoji Line・ Osaka Loop Line commenced operation.

Consequent upon the revision of the schedule implemented on March 13, 1988 in association with the completion of electrification between Kamo and Kizu, the trains departing from this station and directly run through into the Yamatoji Line・ Osaka Loop Line began operating.

Consequent upon the revision of the schedule implemented on March 13, 1988 in association with the completion of electrification between Kamo and Kizu, the trains departing from this station and directly running through into the Yamatoji Line and Osaka Loop Line began operating.
sen.cmt: 文法を一部修正しました。

sen.j: 1897年（明治30年）11月11日 - 伊賀上野駅～当駅間の開通時に、関西鉄道の駅（鉄道駅一般駅）として開業。
sen.e: November 11, 1897 - This station commenced operation as the station of Kansei Railway Company (general railway station) when the section of Iga-Ueno Station～this station came into operation.
November 11, 1897 - This station commenced operation as a facility of the Kansei Railway Company (general railway station) when the section from Iga-Ueno Station to this station became operational.
November 11, 1897: This station commenced operation as a facility of the Kansei Railway Company (general railway station) when the section from Iga-Ueno Station to this station became operational.

sen.j: 1898年（明治31年）4月19日 - 関西鉄道線が大仏駅まで開通。
sen.e: April 19, 1898 - The line of Kansei Railway Company was extended to Daibutsu Station.
April 19, 1898 - The line of the Kansei Railway Company was extended to Daibutsu Station.
April 19, 1898: The line of the Kansei Railway Company was extended to Daibutsu Station.

sen.j: 1898年（明治31年）11月18日 - 関西鉄道線が新木津駅まで開通。
sen.e: November 18, 1898 - The line of Kansei Railway Company was extended to Shin-Kizu Station.
November 18, 1898 - The line of the Kansei Railway Company was extended to Shin-Kizu Station.
November 18, 1898 : The line of the Kansei Railway Company was extended to Shin-Kizu Station.

sen.j: 1907年（明治40年）8月21日 - 当駅～大仏～奈良駅間、当駅～新木津間が廃止。
sen.e: August 21, 1907 - This station～Daibutsu station～Nara Station section and this station～Shin-Kizu Station section were abolished.
August 21, 1907 - The section from this station to Daibutsu Station and Nara Station was abolished, as was the section from this station to Shin-Kizu Station.
August 21, 1907: The section from this station to Daibutsu Station and Nara Station was abolished, as was the section from this station to Shin-Kizu Station.

sen.j: 当駅～木津間の新線が開通。
sen.e: This station～Kizu Station section came into operation.
The section from this station to Kizu Station came into operation.
The section from this station to Kizu Station came into operation.

sen.j: 1907年（明治40年）10月1日 - 関西鉄道が鉄道国有法。
sen.e: October 1, 1907 - Kansei Railway Company was nationalized.
October 1, 1907 - The Kansei Railway Company was nationalized.
October 1, 1907: The Kansei Railway Company was nationalized.

sen.j: 1909年（明治42年）10月12日 - 鉄道路線の名称設定により、関西本線所属となる。
sen.e: October 12, 1909 - In the wake of the establishment of the line name, this station became the station of the Kansai Main Line.
October 12, 1909 - In the wake of the establishment of the line name, this station became a facility of the Kansai Main Line.
October 12, 1909: In the wake of the establishment of the line name, this station became a facility of the Kansai Main Line.

sen.j: 1974年（昭和59年）3月16日 - 貨物営業廃止（鉄道駅旅客駅となる）。
sen.e: March 16, 1974 - Freight service was abolished (this station became a passenger railway station).
March 16, 1974 - Freight service was abolished, whereby this station became a passenger railway station.
March 16, 1974: Freight service was abolished, whereby this station became a passenger railway station.

sen.j: 1987年（昭和62年）4月1日 - 国鉄分割民営化により西日本旅客鉄道の駅となる。
sen.e: April 1, 1987 - This station became the station of West Japan Railway Company (JR West) due to the division and privatization of Japan National Railways (JNR).
April 1, 1987 - This station became a facility of West Japan Railway Company (JR West) due to the division and privatization of Japan National Railways (JNR).
April 1, 1987: This station became a facility of West Japan Railway Company (JR West) due to the division and privatization of Japan National Railways (JNR).

sen.j: 1999年（平成11年）12月21日 - 橋上駅舎に改築。
sen.e: December 21, 1999 - The station building was rebuild and became the station on the bridge.
December 21, 1999 - The station building was rebuilt and became the station on the bridge.
December 21, 1999: The station building was rebuilt and became the station on the bridge.

sen.j: 西日本旅客鉄道
sen.e: West Japan Railway Company (JR West)
West Japan Railway Company (JR West)
West Japan Railway Company (JR West)

sen.j: ■やまとじライナー（到着列車のみ）・■大和路快速・■快速・■区間快速・■普通
